text: Be humble. Be hungry. And always be the hardest worker in the room.
author: The Rock

text: Work hard and be kind and amazing things will happen.
author: Conan O'Brien

text: Hard work beats talent when talent doesn’t work hard
author: Tim Notke

text: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
author: Colin Powell

text: Hard work spotlights the character of people. Some turn up their sleeves. Some turn up their noses, and some don’t turn up at all.
author: Sam Ewing

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: A river cuts through a rock not because of its power but its persistence.
author: Jim Watkins

text: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
author: Newt Gingrich

text: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Work hard in silence, let your success be your noise.
author: Frank Ocean

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. if you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
author: Steve Jobs

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step
author: Martin Luther

text: Working hard for something we dont care about is called stress: Working hard for something we love is called passion.
author: Simon Sinek

text: If you’ve created a work culture where vulnerability isn’t ok, you’ve also created a culture where innovation and creativity aren't ok
author: Brené Brown

text: Don’t confuse having a career with having a life.
author: Hillary Clinton

text: Customers will never love a company until the employees love it first.
author: Simon Sinek

text: The only thing of real importance that leaders do is create and manage culture
author: Edgar Schein

text: Clients do not come first. Employees come first. If you take care of your employees, they will take care of the clients.
author: Richard Branson

text: All good leaders are connectors. They relate well and make people feel confident about themselves and their leader
author: John Maxwell

text: To handle yourself use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
author: Harry Truman

text: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: If you are not growing, you are dying.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Learning is the only thing the mind never exhausts, never fears, and never regrets.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

text: We do not learn from experience. We learn from reflecting on experience.
author: John Dewey

text: No one on his deathbed ever said, ‘I wish I had spent more time at the office.
author: Paul Tsongas

text: Never get so busy making a living that you forget to make a life.
author: Dolly Parton

text: We need to do a better job of putting ourselves higher on our own ‘to do’ list
author: Michelle Obama

text: There is no such thing as work-life balance. It is all life. The balance has to be within you.
author: Sadhguru

text: If you get tired, learn to rest, not to quit.
author: Banksy

text: You can have it all. You just can’t have it all at once.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Be sure when you step, step with care and great tact. And remember that life is a great balancing act.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work in hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: I’m a greater believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: You've got to get up every morning with determination if you're going to go to bed with satisfaction
author: George Lorimer

text: Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t – you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

text: Don’t wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Developing a good work ethic is key. Apply yourself at whatever you do, whether you're a janitor or taking your first summer job because that work ethic will be reflected in everything you do in life.
author: Tyler Perry

text: Happiness is not in the mere possession of money; it lies in the joy of achievement, in the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: The future depends on what you do today
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones
author: Confucius

text: Start by doing what’s necessary, then what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Saint Francis

text: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
author: Eva Young

text: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Talent means nothing, while experience, acquired in humility and with hard work, means everything.
author: Patrick Suskind

text: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don’t quit.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: Happiness is the real sense of fulfillment that comes from hard work.
author: Joseph Barbaraj

text: If you want to make an easy job seem mighty hard, just keep putting off doing it
author: Olin Miller

text: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.
author: Stephen King

text: Once you have commitment, you need the discipline and hard work to get you there.
author: Haile Gebrselassie

text: Your ability to discipline yourself to set clear goals, and then to work toward them every day, will do more to guarantee your success than any other single factor.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Follow effective actions with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it
author: Stephen Hawking

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

text: Nothing ever comes to one, that is worth having, except as a result of hard work.
author: Booker T. Washington

text: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!
author: David O. McKay

text: If you must have motivation, think of your paycheck on Friday.
author: Noel Coward

text: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: Quality is everyone's responsibility.
author: W. Edwards Deming

text: Whatever your life's work is, do it well. A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don't recognize them.
author: Ann Landers

text: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
author: Anne Frank

text: It is the working man who is the happy man. It is the idle man who is the miserable man.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Before you start some work, always ask yourself three questions - Why am I doing it, What the results might be and Will I be successful. Only when you think deeply and find satisfactory answers to these questions, go ahead.
author: Chanakya

text: Good things happen to those who hustle.
author: chuck Noll

text: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

text: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
author: George Burns

text: Without labor nothing prosper
author: Sophocles

text: Working hard and working smart sometimes can be two different things.
author: Byron Dorgan

text: I've learned from experience that if you work harder at it, and apply more energy and time to it, and more consistency, you get a better result. It comes from the work.
author: Louis C. K.

text: I believe in stopping work and eating lunch.
author: L'Wren Scott

text: Inspiration comes of working every day.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: The power of one, if fearless and focused, is formidable, but the power of many working together is bette
author: Gloria Macapagal Arroyo

text: To find joy in work is to discover the fountain of youth.
author: Pearl S. Buck

text: We have a system that increasingly taxes work and subsidizes nonwork.
author: Milton Friedm

text: I guess we all like to be recognized not for one piece of fireworks, but for the ledger of our daily work.
author: Neil Armstrong

text: All wealth is the product of labor.
author: John Locke

text: The supreme accomplishment is to blur the line between work and play.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

text: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.
author: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.

text: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work
author: Harry Golden

text: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
author: Dylan Thomas

text: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength and his pleasure.
author: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength and his pleasure.

text: I know you've heard it a thousand times before. But it's true - hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. If you don't love something, then don't do it.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Every noble work is at first impossible.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: By the work one knows the workman.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

text: Can anything be sadder than work left unfinished? Yes, work never begun.
author: Christina Rossetti

text: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Work, apart from devotion or love of God, is helpless and cannot stand alone.
author: Ramakrishna

text: Ya gots to work with what you gots to work with.
author: Stevie Wonder

text: Luck? I don't know anything about luck. I've never banked on it and I'm afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: Hard work - and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.
author: Lucille Ball

text: And where I excel is ridiculous, sickening, work ethic. You know, while the other guy's sleeping? I'm working.
author: Will Smith

text: Every man's work, whether it be literature, or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
author: Samuel Butler

text: reers, like rockets, don't always take off on time. The trick is to always keep the engine running.
author: Gary Sinise

text: Work isn't to make money; you work to justify life.
author: Marc Chagall

text: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: 'Whose?
author: Don Marquis

text: Economics is extremely useful as a form of employment for economists.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

text: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
author: Ginger Rogers

text: The idea of having a steady job is appealing.
author: The idea of having a steady job is appealing.

text: Work will win when wishy washy wishing won t.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: Nothing is work unless you'd rather be doing something else.
author: George Halas

text: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

text: Men for the sake of getting a living forget to live.
author: Margaret Fuller

text: Working hard is very important. You're not going to get anywhere without working extremely hard.
author: George Lucas

text: A good job is more than just a paycheck. A good job fosters independence and discipline, and contributes to the health of the community. A good job is a means to provide for the health and welfare of your family, to own a home, and save for retirement.
author: James H. Douglas, Jr.

text: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Concentrate on your job and you will forget your other troubles.
author: William Feather

text: Honest labor bears a lovely face.
author: Thomas Dekker

text: The pay is good and I can walk to work.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
author: Robert Frost

text: There is no substitute for hard work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Work, look for peace and calm in work: you will find it nowhere else.
author: Dmitri Mendeleev

text: When you form a team, why do you try to form a team? Because teamwork builds trust and trust builds speed.
author: Russel Honore

text: There's something to be said in favor of working in isolation in the real world.
author: A. R. Ammons

text: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive.
author: Federico Fellini

text: I have found in work that you only get back what you put into it, but it does come back gift-wrapped.
author: Joyce Brothers

text: Unemployment is capitalism's way of getting you to plant a garden.
author: Orson Scott Card

text: No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
author: Max Beerbohm

text: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: I think about my work every minute of the day.
author: Jeff Koons

text: Work is a prayer. And I start off every morning dedicating it to our Creator.
author: Joseph Murray

text: If you put all your strength and faith and vigor into a job and try to do the best you can, the money will come.
author: Lawrence Welk

text: Blessed is he who has found his work; let him ask no other blessedness.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: Be open to the amazing changes which are occurring in the field that interest you.
author: Leigh Steinberg

text: You're blessed if you have the strength to work.
author: Mahalia Jackson

text: No one can arrive from being talented alone, work transforms talent into genius.
author: Anna Pavlova

text: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Every man loves what he is good at.
author: Thomas Shadwell

text: The end of labor is to gain leisure.
author: Aristotle

text: Going to work for a large company is like getting on a train. Are you going sixty miles an hour or is the train going sixty miles an hour and you're just sitting still?
author: J. Paul Getty

text: Most people treat the office manual the way they treat a software manual. They never look at it.
author: James Levine

text: Management must manage!
author: Harold S. Geneen

text: Teaching was the hardest work I had ever done, and it remains the hardest work I have done to date.
author: Ann Richards

text: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Unknown

text: Nobody ever drowned in his own sweat.
author: Ann Landers

text: Everyone has been made for some particular work, and the desire for that work has been put in every heart.
author: Rumi

text: Once you start a working on something, don't be afraid of failure and don't abandon it. People who work sincerely are the happiest.
author: Chanakya

text: Find a job you like and you add five days to every week.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr

text: Work is much more fun than fun.
author: Noel Coward

text: Quality is pride of workmanship
author: W. Edwards Deming

text: My experience has been that work is almost the best way to pull oneself out of the depths.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: What you are will show in what you do.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Married couples who work together to build and maintain a business assume broad responsibilities. Not only is their work important to our local and national economies, but their success is central to the well-being of their families.
author: Melissa Bean

text: If you don't want to work you have to work to earn enough money so that you won't have to work.
author: Ogden Nash

text: Work is a necessity for man. Man invented the alarm clock.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Give yourself something to work toward - constantly.
author: Mary Kay Ash

text: Big jobs usually go to the men who prove their ability to outgrow small ones.
author: Theodore Roosevelt
